meanings.definition: The ability to make considered decisions or come to sensible conclusions.
meanings.sent1: Her judgement in choosing the right path was commendable.
meanings.sent2: I trust your judgement on this matter.
meanings.sent3: His judgement in picking the best ice cream flavor was spot on.
meanings.sent4: The judgement of the referee was questioned by the fans.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's judgement of the students' work was fair and accurate.

meanings.definition: An opinion or conclusion reached after careful consideration.
meanings.sent1: My judgement is that we should go with option B.
meanings.sent2: What is your judgement on the new policy?
meanings.sent3: Her judgement that cats are better than dogs sparked a friendly debate.
meanings.sent4: The judgement of the jury was unanimous.
meanings.sent5: His judgement that the movie would be a hit turned out to be correct.

meanings.definition: The process of forming an opinion or evaluation by discerning and comparing.
meanings.sent1: The judgement of the artwork required a keen eye for detail.
meanings.sent2: The judgement of the quality of the product was based on customer feedback.
meanings.sent3: Their judgement of the best pizza toppings led to a delicious creation.
meanings.sent4: The judgement of the situation was clouded by conflicting information.
meanings.sent5: The expert's judgement of the market trends was invaluable for the company's success.
